snippet: With the money New York City spends fighting lawsuits with scorched-earth tactics, it could repave 65 miles of streets, or pay for 80 police officers or 159 teachers, or 887 seats in Head Start.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column observes the money New York City spends fighting lawsuits with scorched-earth litigation tactics, which amounts to some $10 million, could instead repave 65 miles of streets, pay for 80 police officers or 159 teachers, or cover cost of  887 seats in Head Start.
lead_paragraph: With the money New York City spends fighting lawsuits with scorched-earth tactics, it could repave 65 miles of streets, or pay for 80 police officers or 159 teachers, or 887 seats in Head Start.

headline.main: In High Costs of City’s Litigation, a Litany of Missed Opportunities
